statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \cos 2 x \cdot \cos 4 x \cdot \cos 6 x \,

step.context: \text{Are the following calculations and analysis correct?}
step.tex:
\text{Using trignometric identity,}\\
\begin{align}
\cos x \cos y &= \dfrac{1}{2}[\cos (x+y) + \cos (x-y)] \\ \implies \cos 4x \cos 6x &= \dfrac{1}{2}[\cos 10 x + \cos 2 x] \\ \end{align}\\
\text{So, } \cos 2 x \cdot \cos 4 x \cdot \cos 6 x \\ \qquad \qquad = \dfrac{1}{2}[\cos 2x \cos 10 x + \cos 2 x \cos 2 x] \\
\qquad \qquad = \dfrac{1}{4} [ \cos 12 x + \cos 8 x + 1 + \cos 4 x ] \\
\therefore \int \cos 2 x \cdot \cos 4 x \cdot \cos 6 x \, dx \\ \qquad \qquad = \int \dfrac{1}{4} [ \cos 12 x + \cos 8 x + 1 + \cos 4 x ] dx
